speaker: trump
text: Madam Speaker, Mr. Vice President, Members of Congress, the First Lady of the United States, and my fellow Americans:

speaker: trump
text: We meet tonight at a moment of unlimited potential.

speaker: trump
text: As we begin a new Congress, I stand here ready to work with you to achieve historic breakthroughs for all Americans.

speaker: trump
text: Millions of our fellow citizens are watching us now, gathered in this great chamber, hoping that we will govern not as two parties but as one Nation.

speaker: trump
text: The agenda I will lay out this evening is not a Republican agenda or a Democrat agenda.

speaker: trump
text: It is the agenda of the American people.

speaker: trump
text: Many of us campaigned on the same core promises: to defend American jobs and demand fair trade for American workers;

speaker: trump
text: to rebuild and revitalize our Nation's infrastructure;

speaker: trump
text: to reduce the price of healthcare and prescription drugs;

speaker: trump
text: to create an immigration system that is safe, lawful, modern and secure;

speaker: trump
text: and to pursue a foreign policy that puts America's interests first.

speaker: trump
text: There is a new opportunity in American politics, if only we have the courage to seize it.

speaker: trump
text: Victory is not winning for our party.

speaker: trump
text: Victory is winning for our country.

speaker: trump
text: This year, America will recognize two important anniversaries that show us the majesty of America's mission, and the power of American pride.

speaker: trump
text: In June, we mark 75 years since the start of what General Dwight D. Eisenhower called the Great Crusade -- the Allied liberation of Europe in World War II.

speaker: trump
text: On D-Day, June 6, 1944, 15,000 young American men jumped from the sky, and 60,000 more stormed in from the sea, to save our civilization from tyranny.

speaker: trump
text: Here with us tonight are three of those heroes: Private First Class Joseph Reilly, Staff Sergeant Irving Locker, and Sergeant Herman Zeitchik.
noun_phrases: ['joseph reilly', 'staff sergeant irving locker', 'sergeant herman zeitchik']

speaker: trump
text: Gentlemen, we salute you.

speaker: trump
text: In 2019, we also celebrate 50 years since brave young pilots flew a quarter of a million miles through space to plant the American flag on the face of the moon.

speaker: trump
text: Half a century later, we are joined by one of the Apollo 11 astronauts who planted that flag: Buzz Aldrin.

speaker: trump
text: This year, American astronauts will go back to space on American rockets.

speaker: trump
text: In the 20th century, America saved freedom, transformed science, and redefined the middle class standard of living for the entire world to see.

speaker: trump
text: Now, we must step boldly and bravely into the next chapter of this great American adventure, and we must create a new standard of living for the 21st century.

speaker: trump
text: An amazing quality of life for all of our citizens is within our reach.

speaker: trump
text: We can make our communities safer, our families stronger, our culture richer, our faith deeper, and our middle class bigger and more prosperous than ever before.

speaker: trump
text: But we must reject the politics of revenge, resistance, and retribution -- and embrace the boundless potential of cooperation, compromise, and the common good.

speaker: trump
text: Together, we can break decades of political stalemate.

speaker: trump
text: We can bridge old divisions, heal old wounds, build new coalitions, forge new solutions, and unlock the extraordinary promise of America's future.

speaker: trump
text: The decision is ours to make.

speaker: trump
text: We must choose between greatness or gridlock, results or resistance, vision or vengeance, incredible progress or pointless destruction.

speaker: trump
text: Tonight, I ask you to choose greatness.

speaker: trump
text: Over the last 2 years, my Administration has moved with urgency and historic speed to confront problems neglected by leaders of both parties over many decades.

speaker: trump
text: In just over 2 years since the election, we have launched an unprecedented economic boom -- a boom that has rarely been seen before.

speaker: trump
text: We have created 5.3 million new jobs and importantly added 600,000 new manufacturing jobs -- something which almost everyone said was impossible to do, but the fact is, we are just getting started.

speaker: trump
text: Wages are rising at the fastest pace in decades, and growing for blue collar workers, who I promised to fight for, faster than anyone else.

speaker: trump
text: Nearly 5 million Americans have been lifted off food stamps.

speaker: trump
text: The United States economy is growing almost twice as fast today as when I took office, and we are considered far and away the hottest economy anywhere in the world.

speaker: trump
text: Unemployment has reached the lowest rate in half a century.

speaker: trump
text: African-American, Hispanic-American and Asian-American unemployment have all reached their lowest levels ever recorded.

speaker: trump
text: Unemployment for Americans with disabilities has also reached an all-time low.

speaker: trump
text: More people are working now than at any time in our history --- 157 million.

speaker: trump
text: We passed a massive tax cut for working families and doubled the child tax credit.

speaker: trump
text: We virtually ended the estate, or death, tax on small businesses, ranches, and family farms.

speaker: trump
text: We eliminated the very unpopular Obamacare individual mandate penalty -- and to give critically ill patients access to life-saving cures, we passed right to try.

speaker: trump
text: My Administration has cut more regulations in a short time than any other administration during its entire tenure.

speaker: trump
text: Companies are coming back to our country in large numbers thanks to historic reductions in taxes and regulations.

speaker: trump
text: We have unleashed a revolution in American energy -- the United States is now the number one producer of oil and natural gas in the world.

speaker: trump
text: And now, for the first time in 65 years, we are a net exporter of energy.

speaker: trump
text: After 24 months of rapid progress, our economy is the envy of the world, our military is the most powerful on earth, and America is winning each and every day.

speaker: trump
text: the State of our Union is strong.

speaker: trump
text: Our country is vibrant and our economy is thriving like never before.

speaker: trump
text: On Friday, it was announced that we added another 304,000 jobs last month alone -- almost double what was expected.

speaker: trump
text: An economic miracle is taking place in the United States -- and the only thing that can stop it are foolish wars, politics, or ridiculous partisan investigations.

speaker: trump
text: If there is going to be peace and legislation, there cannot be war and investigation.

speaker: trump
text: It just doesn't work that way!

speaker: trump
text: We must be united at home to defeat our adversaries abroad.

speaker: trump
text: This new era of cooperation can start with finally confirming the more than 300 highly qualified nominees who are still stuck in the Senate -- some after years of waiting.

speaker: trump
text: The Senate has failed to act on these nominations, which is unfair to the nominees and to our country.

speaker: trump
text: Now is the time for bipartisan action.

speaker: trump
text: Believe it or not, we have already proven that it is possible.

speaker: trump
text: In the last Congress, both parties came together to pass unprecedented legislation to confront the opioid crisis, a sweeping new Farm Bill, historic VA reforms, and after four decades of rejection, we passed VA Accountability so we can finally terminate those who mistreat our wonderful veterans.

speaker: trump
text: And just weeks ago, both parties united for groundbreaking criminal justice reform.

speaker: trump
text: Last year, I heard through friends the story of Alice Johnson.

speaker: trump
text: I was deeply moved.

speaker: trump
text: In 1997, Alice was sentenced to life in prison as a first-time non-violent drug offender.

speaker: trump
text: Over the next two decades, she became a prison minister, inspiring others to choose a better path.

speaker: trump
text: She had a big impact on that prison population -- and far beyond.

speaker: trump
text: Alice's story underscores the disparities and unfairness that can exist in criminal sentencing -- and the need to remedy this injustice.

speaker: trump
text: She served almost 22 years and had expected to be in prison for the rest of her life.

speaker: trump
text: In June, I commuted Alice's sentence -- and she is here with us tonight.

speaker: trump
text: Alice, thank you for reminding us that we always have the power to shape our own destiny.

speaker: trump
text: When I saw Alice's beautiful family greet her at the prison gates, hugging and kissing and crying and laughing, I knew I did the right thing.

speaker: trump
text: Inspired by stories like Alice's, my Administration worked closely with members of both parties to sign the First Step Act into law.

speaker: trump
text: This legislation reformed sentencing laws that have wrongly and disproportionately harmed the African-American community.

speaker: trump
text: The First Step Act gives non-violent offenders the chance to re-enter society as productive, law-abiding citizens.

speaker: trump
text: Now, States across the country are following our lead.

speaker: trump
text: America is a Nation that believes in redemption.

speaker: trump
text: We are also joined tonight by Matthew Charles from Tennessee.

speaker: trump
text: In 1996, at age 30, Matthew was sentenced to 35 years for selling drugs and related offenses.

speaker: trump
text: Over the next two decades, he completed more than 30 Bible studies, became a law clerk, and mentored fellow inmates.

speaker: trump
text: Now, Matthew is the very first person to be released from prison under the First Step Act.

speaker: trump
text: Matthew, on behalf of all Americans: welcome home.

speaker: trump
text: As we have seen, when we are united, we can make astonishing strides for our country.

speaker: trump
text: Now, Republicans and Democrats must join forces again to confront an urgent national crisis.

speaker: trump
text: The Congress has 10 days left to pass a bill that will fund our Government, protect our homeland, and secure our southern border.

speaker: trump
text: Now is the time for the Congress to show the world that America is committed to ending illegal immigration and putting the ruthless coyotes, cartels, drug dealers, and human traffickers out of business.

speaker: trump
text: As we speak, large, organized caravans are on the march to the United States.

speaker: trump
text: We have just heard that Mexican cities, in order to remove the illegal immigrants from their communities, are getting trucks and buses to bring them up to our country in areas where there is little border protection.

speaker: trump
text: I have ordered another 3,750 troops to our southern border to prepare for the tremendous onslaught.

speaker: trump
text: This is a moral issue.

speaker: trump
text: The lawless state of our southern border is a threat to the safety, security, and financial wellâ€‘being of all Americans.

speaker: trump
text: We have a moral duty to create an immigration system that protects the lives and jobs of our citizens.

speaker: trump
text: This includes our obligation to the millions of immigrants living here today, who followed the rules and respected our laws.

speaker: trump
text: Legal immigrants enrich our Nation and strengthen our society in countless ways.

speaker: trump
text: I want people to come into our country, but they have to come in legally.

speaker: trump
text: Tonight, I am asking you to defend our very dangerous southern border out of love and devotion to our fellow citizens and to our country.

speaker: trump
text: No issue better illustrates the divide between America's working class and America's political class than illegal immigration.

speaker: trump
text: Wealthy politicians and donors push for open borders while living their lives behind walls and gates and guards.

speaker: trump
text: Meanwhile, working class Americans are left to pay the price for mass illegal migration -- reduced jobs, lower wages, overburdened schools and hospitals, increased crime, and a depleted social safety net.

speaker: trump
text: Tolerance for illegal immigration is not compassionate -- it is cruel.

speaker: trump
text: One in three women is sexually assaulted on the long journey north.

speaker: trump
text: Smugglers use migrant children as human pawns to exploit our laws and gain access to our country.

speaker: trump
text: Human traffickers and sex traffickers take advantage of the wide open areas between our ports of entry to smuggle thousands of young girls and women into the United States and to sell them into prostitution and modern-day slavery.
noun_phrases: ['human traffickers', 'sex traffickers', 'wide open areas', 'smuggle thousands', 'young girls', 'modern-day slavery']

speaker: trump
text: Tens of thousands of innocent Americans are killed by lethal drugs that cross our border and flood into our cities -- including meth, heroin, cocaine, and fentanyl.

speaker: trump
text: The savage gang, MS-13, now operates in 20 different American States, and they almost all come through our southern border.

speaker: trump
text: Just yesterday, an MS-13 gang member was taken into custody for a fatal shooting on a subway platform in New York City.

speaker: trump
text: We are removing these gang members by the thousands, but until we secure our border they're going to keep streaming back in.

speaker: trump
text: Year after year, countless Americans are murdered by criminal illegal aliens.

speaker: trump
text: I've gotten to know many wonderful Angel Moms, Dads, and families -- no one should ever have to suffer the horrible heartache they have endured.

speaker: trump
text: Here tonight is Debra Bissell.

speaker: trump
text: Just three weeks ago, Debra's parents, Gerald and Sharon, were burglarized and shot to death in their Reno, Nevada, home by an illegal alien.

speaker: trump
text: They were in their eighties and are survived by four children, 11 grandchildren, and 20 great-grandchildren.

speaker: trump
text: Also here tonight are Gerald and Sharon's granddaughter, Heather, and greatâ€‘granddaughter, Madison.

speaker: trump
text: To Debra, Heather, Madison, please stand: few can understand your pain.

speaker: trump
text: But I will never forget, and I will fight for the memory of Gerald and Sharon, that it should never happen again.

speaker: trump
text: Not one more American life should be lost because our Nation failed to control its very dangerous border.

speaker: trump
text: In the last 2 years, our brave ICE officers made 266,000 arrests of criminal aliens, including those charged or convicted of nearly 100,000 assaults, 30,000 sex crimes, and 4,000 killings.

speaker: trump
text: We are joined tonight by one of those law enforcement heroes: ICE Special Agent Elvin Hernandez.

speaker: trump
text: When Elvin was a boy, he and his family legally immigrated to the United States from the Dominican Republic.

speaker: trump
text: At the age of eight, Elvin told his dad he wanted to become a Special Agent.

speaker: trump
text: Today, he leads investigations into the scourge of international sex trafficking.

speaker: trump
text: "If I can make sure these young girls get their justice, I've done my job."

speaker: trump
text: Thanks to his work and that of his colleagues, more than 300 women and girls have been rescued from horror and more than 1,500 sadistic traffickers have been put behind bars in the last year.

speaker: trump
text: Special Agent Hernandez, please stand: We will always support the brave men and women of Law Enforcement -- and I pledge to you tonight that we will never abolish our heroes from ICE.

speaker: trump
text: My Administration has sent to the Congress a commonsense proposal to end the crisis on our southern border.

speaker: trump
text: It includes humanitarian assistance, more law enforcement, drug detection at our ports, closing loopholes that enable child smuggling, and plans for a new physical barrier, or wall, to secure the vast areas between our ports of entry.
noun_phrases: ['humanitarian assistance', 'law enforcement', 'drug detection', 'enable child', 'new physical barrier', 'vast areas']

speaker: trump
text: In the past, most of the people in this room voted for a wall -- but the proper wall never got built.

speaker: trump
text: I'll get it built.

speaker: trump
text: This is a smart, strategic, see-through steel barrier -- not just a simple concrete wall.

speaker: trump
text: It will be deployed in the areas identified by border agents as having the greatest need, and as these agents will tell you, where walls go up, illegal crossings go way down.

speaker: trump
text: San Diego used to have the most illegal border crossings in the country.

speaker: trump
text: In response, and at the request of San Diego residents and political leaders, a strong security wall was put in place.

speaker: trump
text: This powerful barrier almost completely ended illegal crossings.

speaker: trump
text: The border city of El Paso, Texas, used to have extremely high rates of violent crime -- one of the highest in the country, and considered one of our Nation's most dangerous cities.

speaker: trump
text: Now, with a powerful barrier in place, El Paso is one of our safest cities.

speaker: trump
text: Simply put, walls work and walls save lives.

speaker: trump
text: So let's work together, compromise, and reach a deal that will truly make America safe.

speaker: trump
text: As we work to defend our people's safety, we must also ensure our economic resurgence continues at a rapid pace.

speaker: trump
text: No one has benefitted more from our thriving economy than women, who have filled 58 percent of the new jobs created in the last year.

speaker: trump
text: All Americans can be proud that we have more women in the workforce than ever before -- and exactly one century after the Congress passed the Constitutional amendment giving women the right to vote, we also have more women serving in the Congress than ever before.

speaker: trump
text: As part of our commitment to improving opportunity for women everywhere, this Thursday we are launching the first ever Government-wide initiative focused on economic empowerment for women in developing countries.

speaker: trump
text: To build on our incredible economic success, one priority is paramount -- reversing decades of calamitous trade policies.

speaker: trump
text: We are now making it clear to China that after years of targeting our industries, and stealing our intellectual property, the theft of American jobs and wealth has come to an end.

speaker: trump
text: Therefore, we recently imposed tariffs on $250 billion of Chinese goods -- and now our Treasury is receiving billions of dollars a month from a country that never gave us a dime.

speaker: trump
text: But I don't blame China for taking advantage of us -- I blame our leaders and representatives for allowing this travesty to happen.

speaker: trump
text: I have great respect for President Xi, and we are now working on a new trade deal with China.

speaker: trump
text: But it must include real, structural change to end unfair trade practices, reduce our chronic trade deficit, and protect American jobs.

speaker: trump
text: Another historic trade blunder was the catastrophe known as NAFTA.

speaker: trump
text: I have met the men and women of Michigan, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Indiana, New Hampshire, and many other States whose dreams were shattered by NAFTA.

speaker: trump
text: For years, politicians promised them they would negotiate for a better deal.

speaker: trump
text: But no one ever tried -- until now.

speaker: trump
text: Our new U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement -- or USMCA -- will replace NAFTA and deliver for American workers: bringing back our manufacturing jobs, expanding American agriculture, protecting intellectual property, and ensuring that more cars are proudly stamped with four beautiful words: made in the USA.

speaker: trump
text: Tonight, I am also asking you to pass the United States Reciprocal Trade Act, so that if another country places an unfair tariff on an American product, we can charge them the exact same tariff on the same product that they sell to us.

speaker: trump
text: Both parties should be able to unite for a great rebuilding of America's crumbling infrastructure.

speaker: trump
text: I know that the Congress is eager to pass an infrastructure bill -- and I am eager to work with you on legislation to deliver new and important infrastructure investment, including investments in the cutting edge industries of the future.

speaker: trump
text: This is not an option.

speaker: trump
text: This is a necessity.

speaker: trump
text: The next major priority for me, and for all of us, should be to lower the cost of healthcare and prescription drugs -- and to protect patients with pre-existing conditions.

speaker: trump
text: Already, as a result of my Administration's efforts, in 2018 drug prices experienced their single largest decline in 46 years.

speaker: trump
text: But we must do more.

speaker: trump
text: It is unacceptable that Americans pay vastly more than people in other countries for the exact same drugs, often made in the exact same place.

speaker: trump
text: This is wrong, unfair, and together we can stop it.

speaker: trump
text: I am asking the Congress to pass legislation that finally takes on the problem of global freeloading and delivers fairness and price transparency for American patients.

speaker: trump
text: We should also require drug companies, insurance companies, and hospitals to disclose real prices to foster competition and bring costs down.

speaker: trump
text: No force in history has done more to advance the human condition than American freedom.

speaker: trump
text: In recent years we have made remarkable progress in the fight against HIV and AIDS.

speaker: trump
text: Scientific breakthroughs have brought a once-distant dream within reach.

speaker: trump
text: My budget will ask Democrats and Republicans to make the needed commitment to eliminate the HIV epidemic in the United States within 10 years.

speaker: trump
text: Together, we will defeat AIDS in America.

speaker: trump
text: Tonight, I am also asking you to join me in another fight that all Americans can get behind: the fight against childhood cancer.

speaker: trump
text: Joining Melania in the gallery this evening is a very brave 10-year-old girl, Grace Eline.

speaker: trump
text: Every birthday since she was 4, Grace asked her friends to donate to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital.

speaker: trump
text: She did not know that one day she might be a patient herself.

speaker: trump
text: Last year, Grace was diagnosed with brain cancer.

speaker: trump
text: Immediately, she began radiation treatment.

speaker: trump
text: At the same time, she rallied her community and raised more than $40,000 for the fight against cancer.

speaker: trump
text: When Grace completed treatment last fall, her doctors and nurses cheered with tears in their eyes as she hung up a poster that read: "Last Day of Chemo."

speaker: trump
text: Grace -- you are an inspiration to us all.

speaker: trump
text: Many childhood cancers have not seen new therapies in decades.

speaker: trump
text: My budget will ask the Congress for $500 million over the next 10 years to fund this critical life-saving research.

speaker: trump
text: To help support working parents, the time has come to pass school choice for America's children.

speaker: trump
text: I am also proud to be the first President to include in my budget a plan for nationwide paid family leave -- so that every new parent has the chance to bond with their newborn child.

speaker: trump
text: There could be no greater contrast to the beautiful image of a mother holding her infant child than the chilling displays our Nation saw in recent days.

speaker: trump
text: Lawmakers in New York cheered with delight upon the passage of legislation that would allow a baby to be ripped from the mother's womb moments before birth.

speaker: trump
text: These are living, feeling, beautiful babies who will never get the chance to share their love and dreams with the world.

speaker: trump
text: And then, we had the case of the Governor of Virginia where he basically stated he would execute a baby after birth.

speaker: trump
text: To defend the dignity of every person, I am asking the Congress to pass legislation to prohibit the late-term abortion of children who can feel pain in the mother's womb.

speaker: trump
text: Let us work together to build a culture that cherishes innocent life.

speaker: trump
text: And let us reaffirm a fundamental truth: all children -- born and unborn -- are made in the holy image of God.

speaker: trump
text: The final part of my agenda is to protect America's National Security.

speaker: trump
text: Over the last 2 years, we have begun to fully rebuild the United States Military -- with $700 billion last year and $716 billion this year.

speaker: trump
text: We are also getting other nations to pay their fair share.

speaker: trump
text: For years, the United States was being treated very unfairly by NATO -- but now we have secured a $100 billion increase in defense spending from NATO allies.

speaker: trump
text: As part of our military build-up, the United States is developing a state-of-the-art Missile Defense System.

speaker: trump
text: Under my Administration, we will never apologize for advancing America's interests.

speaker: trump
text: For example, decades ago the United States entered into a treaty with Russia in which we agreed to limit and reduce our missile capabilities.

speaker: trump
text: While we followed the agreement to the letter, Russia repeatedly violated its terms.

speaker: trump
text: That is why I announced that the United States is officially withdrawing from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty, or INF Treaty.

speaker: trump
text: Perhaps we can negotiate a different agreement, adding China and others, or perhaps we can't --- in which case, we will outspend and out-innovate all others by far.

speaker: trump
text: As part of a bold new diplomacy, we continue our historic push for peace on the Korean Peninsula.

speaker: trump
text: Our hostages have come home, nuclear testing has stopped, and there has not been a missile launch in 15 months.

speaker: trump
text: If I had not been elected President of the United States, we would right now, in my opinion, be in a major war with North Korea with potentially millions of people killed.

speaker: trump
text: Much work remains to be done, but my relationship with Kim Jong Un is a good one.

speaker: trump
text: And Chairman Kim and I will meet again on February 27 and 28 in Vietnam.

speaker: trump
text: Two weeks ago, the United States officially recognized the legitimate government of Venezuela, and its new interim President, Juan Guaido.

speaker: trump
text: We stand with the Venezuelan people in their noble quest for freedom -- and we condemn the brutality of the Maduro regime, whose socialist policies have turned that nation from being the wealthiest in South America into a state of abject poverty and despair.

speaker: trump
text: Here, in the United States, we are alarmed by new calls to adopt socialism in our country.

speaker: trump
text: America was founded on liberty and independence --- not government coercion, domination, and control.

speaker: trump
text: We are born free, and we will stay free.

speaker: trump
text: Tonight, we renew our resolve that America will never be a socialist country.

speaker: trump
text: One of the most complex set of challenges we face is in the Middle East.

speaker: trump
text: Our approach is based on principled realism -- not discredited theories that have failed for decades to yield progress.

speaker: trump
text: For this reason, my Administration recognized the true capital of Israel -- and proudly opened the American Embassy in Jerusalem.

speaker: trump
text: Our brave troops have now been fighting in the Middle East for almost 19 years.

speaker: trump
text: In Afghanistan and Iraq, nearly 7,000 American heroes have given their lives.

speaker: trump
text: More than 52,000 Americans have been badly wounded.

speaker: trump
text: We have spent more than $7 trillion in the Middle East.

speaker: trump
text: As a candidate for President, I pledged a new approach.

speaker: trump
text: Great nations do not fight endless wars.

speaker: trump
text: When I took office, ISIS controlled more than 20,000 square miles in Iraq and Syria.

speaker: trump
text: Today, we have liberated virtually all of that territory from the grip of these bloodthirsty killers.

speaker: trump
text: Now, as we work with our allies to destroy the remnants of ISIS, it is time to give our brave warriors in Syria a warm welcome home.

speaker: trump
text: I have also accelerated our negotiations to reach a political settlement in Afghanistan.

speaker: trump
text: Our troops have fought with unmatched valor -- and thanks to their bravery, we are now able to pursue a political solution to this long and bloody conflict.

speaker: trump
text: In Afghanistan, my Administration is holding constructive talks with a number of Afghan groups, including the Taliban.

speaker: trump
text: As we make progress in these negotiations, we will be able to reduce our troop presence and focus on counter-terrorism.

speaker: trump
text: We do not know whether we will achieve an agreement -- but we do know that after two decades of war, the hour has come to at least try for peace.

speaker: trump
text: Above all, friend and foe alike must never doubt this Nation's power and will to defend our people.

speaker: trump
text: Eighteen years ago, terrorists attacked the USS Cole -- and last month American forces killed one of the leaders of the attack.

speaker: trump
text: We are honored to be joined tonight by Tom Wibberley, whose son, Navy Seaman Craig Wibberley, was one of the 17 sailors we tragically lost.

speaker: trump
text: we vow to always remember the heroes of the USS Cole.

speaker: trump
text: My Administration has acted decisively to confront the world's leading state sponsor of terror: the radical regime in Iran.

speaker: trump
text: To ensure this corrupt dictatorship never acquires nuclear weapons, I withdrew the United States from the disastrous Iran nuclear deal.

speaker: trump
text: And last fall, we put in place the toughest sanctions ever imposed on a country.

speaker: trump
text: We will not avert our eyes from a regime that chants death to America and threatens genocide against the Jewish people.

speaker: trump
text: We must never ignore the vile poison of anti-Semitism, or those who spread its venomous creed.

speaker: trump
text: With one voice, we must confront this hatred anywhere and everywhere it occurs.

speaker: trump
text: Just months ago, 11 Jewish-Americans were viciously murdered in an anti-semitic attack on the Tree of Life Synagogue in Pittsburgh.

speaker: trump
text: SWAT Officer Timothy Matson raced into the gunfire and was shot seven times chasing down the killer.

speaker: trump
text: Timothy has just had his 12th surgery -- but he made the trip to be here with us tonight.

speaker: trump
text: we are forever grateful for your courage in the face of evil.

speaker: trump
text: Tonight, we are also joined by Pittsburgh survivor Judah Samet.

speaker: trump
text: He arrived at the synagogue as the massacre began.

speaker: trump
text: But not only did Judah narrowly escape death last fall -- more than seven decades ago, he narrowly survived the Nazi concentration camps.

speaker: trump
text: Today is Judah's 81st birthday.

speaker: trump
text: Judah says he can still remember the exact moment, nearly 75 years ago, after 10 months in a concentration camp, when he and his family were put on a train, and told they were going to another camp.

speaker: trump
text: Suddenly the train screeched to a halt.

speaker: trump
text: A soldier appeared.

speaker: trump
text: Judah's family braced for the worst.

speaker: trump
text: Then, his father cried out with joy: "It's the Americans."

speaker: trump
text: A second Holocaust survivor who is here tonight, Joshua Kaufman, was a prisoner at Dachau Concentration Camp.

speaker: trump
text: He remembers watching through a hole in the wall of a cattle car as American soldiers rolled in with tanks.

speaker: trump
text: "To me," Joshua recalls, "the American soldiers were proof that God exists, and they came down from the sky."

speaker: trump
text: I began this evening by honoring three soldiers who fought on D-Day in the Second World War.

speaker: trump
text: One of them was Herman Zeitchik.

speaker: trump
text: But there is more to Herman's story.

speaker: trump
text: A year after he stormed the beaches of Normandy, Herman was one of those American soldiers who helped liberate Dachau.

speaker: trump
text: He was one of the Americans who helped rescue Joshua from that hell on earth.

speaker: trump
text: Almost 75 years later, Herman and Joshua are both together in the gallery tonight -- seated side-by-side, here in the home of American freedom.

speaker: trump
text: your presence this evening honors and uplifts our entire Nation.

speaker: trump
text: When American soldiers set out beneath the dark skies over the English Channel in the early hours of D-Day, 1944, they were just young men of 18 and 19, hurtling on fragile landing craft toward the most momentous battle in the history of war.

speaker: trump
text: They did not know if they would survive the hour.

speaker: trump
text: They did not know if they would grow old.

speaker: trump
text: But they knew that America had to prevail.

speaker: trump
text: Their cause was this Nation, and generations yet unborn.

speaker: trump
text: Why did they do it?

speaker: trump
text: They did it for America -- they did it for us.

speaker: trump
text: Everything that has come since -- our triumph over communism, our giant leaps of science and discovery, our unrivaled progress toward equality and justice -- all of it is possible thanks to the blood and tears and courage and vision of the Americans who came before.

speaker: trump
text: Think of this Capitol -- think of this very chamber, where lawmakers before you voted to end slavery, to build the railroads and the highways, to defeat fascism, to secure civil rights, to face down an evil empire.

speaker: trump
text: Here tonight, we have legislators from across this magnificent republic.

speaker: trump
text: You have come from the rocky shores of Maine and the volcanic peaks of Hawaii; from the snowy woods of Wisconsin and the red deserts of Arizona; from the green farms of Kentucky and the golden beaches of California.

speaker: trump
text: Together, we represent the most extraordinary Nation in all of history.

speaker: trump
text: What will we do with this moment?

speaker: trump
text: How will we be remembered?

speaker: trump
text: I ask the men and women of this Congress: Look at the opportunities before us!

speaker: trump
text: Our most thrilling achievements are still ahead.

speaker: trump
text: Our most exciting journeys still await.

speaker: trump
text: Our biggest victories are still to come.

speaker: trump
text: We have not yet begun to dream.

speaker: trump
text: We must choose whether we are defined by our differences -- or whether we dare to transcend them.

speaker: trump
text: We must choose whether we will squander our inheritance -- or whether we will proudly declare that we are Americans.

speaker: trump
text: We do the incredible.

speaker: trump
text: We defy the impossible.

speaker: trump
text: We conquer the unknown.

speaker: trump
text: This is the time to re-ignite the American imagination.

speaker: trump
text: This is the time to search for the tallest summit, and set our sights on the brightest star.

speaker: trump
text: This is the time to rekindle the bonds of love and loyalty and memory that link us together as citizens, as neighbors, as patriots.

speaker: trump
text: This is our future -- our fate -- and our choice to make.

speaker: trump
text: I am asking you to choose greatness.

speaker: trump
text: No matter the trials we face, no matter the challenges to come, we must go forward together.

speaker: trump
text: We must keep America first in our hearts.

speaker: trump
text: We must keep freedom alive in our souls.

speaker: trump
text: And we must always keep faith in America's destiny -- that one Nation, under God, must be the hope and the promise and the light and the glory among all the nations of the world!

speaker: trump
text: Thank you.

speaker: trump
text: God Bless You, God Bless America, and good night!
